## Description
Please provide a summary of the changes made in this pull request. Include any relevant motivation and context for the changes, especially how they help developers open-source their repositories.

Fixes # (issue)

## Type of Change
Please delete options that are not relevant.
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue related to the open-sourcing process or analysis)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality to assist with open-sourcing, e.g., new analysis capabilities, improved integrations)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected, particularly impacting repository analysis or generation)
- [ ] Documentation update (updates to guides, READMEs, or inline code comments relevant to the project's purpose)
- [ ] Refactor (code restructuring that doesn't change external behavior, but improves maintainability or performance of the open-sourcing tool)

## How Has This Been Tested?
Please describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes. Include instructions for reproducing the tests and any relevant details about your test configuration. For changes related to repository analysis, consider testing with various types of GitHub repositories (public, private, different languages/structures).

## Checklist
- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project.
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code.
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas, explaining its role in the open-sourcing workflow.
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation, if applicable.
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings.
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works, especially for new open-sourcing functionalities.
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes.

## Additional Notes
Add any other context or information that may be helpful for the reviewers, especially regarding the impact on the open-sourcing capabilities or user experience.
